sentences.en: Evidence is classified as real evidence, testimony, direct evidence, and circumstantial evidence.
sentences.cn: 证据被分为实物证据 、 言词证据 、 直接证据和间接证据.

sentences.en: Fast work by the police in Birmingham had started producing circumstantial evidence.
sentences.cn: 快速开展工作的伯明翰警方已经开始发现间接证据。

sentences.en: His pages march on, direct and circumstantial.
sentences.cn: 他的文章滔滔不绝, 稳健有力,紧密细致.

sentences.en: In general, evidence is divided into two categories: circumstantial and physical.
sentences.cn: 一般来讲, 证据被划分为两种,间接证据和实物证据.

sentences.en: Minor details are circumstantial compared with the main fact.
sentences.cn: 细节与主要事实相比处于次要地位.

sentences.en: Most of those reports were a nightmare - grotesque, circumstantial , eager, and untrue.
sentences.cn: 那些报道大多数都是一场噩梦 ― ―离奇古怪, 捕风捉影, 煞有介事, 而且不真实.

sentences.en: My memory is circumstantial and unshaken.
Suspicion points to him, but the evidence is circumstantial.
sentences.cn: 他直接受到怀疑, 但证据却是间接的.

sentences.en: The book includes a long and circumstantial account of Empson’s conversation with the Queen.
sentences.cn: 这本书以很长的篇幅详细记录了恩普森和女王的谈话。

sentences.en: The case against him was largely circumstantial.
sentences.cn: 对他不利的案情大多为间接推测的。

sentences.en: The evidence against him was purely circumstantial.
sentences.cn: 对他不利的这项证据完全是间接证据。

sentences.en: The jury will not convict on circumstantial evidence alone.
sentences.cn: 陪审团不会仅仅根据旁证来定罪.

sentences.en: The reasons for the project collapsing were circumstantial.
There is much circumstantial evidence and some direct evidence.
sentences.cn: 有许多间接证据和一些直接证据.

sentences.en: We should point out that the evidence is purely circumstantial.
sentences.cn: 我们应该指出,证据完全是依情况而定的.

sentences.en: You can't convict him merely on circumstantial evidence.
sentences.cn: 你不能仅凭间接证据判他有罪.

words.tran_cn: 按情况推测的,看情形的

trans.tran_cn: （指描述）详细的，（指证据）有充分细节却无法证实的
